tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: let the earth rejoice; let the many coastlands be glad
tn.text: The earth and the coastlands are said to have emotions like people. AT: "Rejoice and be glad every person on the earth and near the seas" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Possible meanings are 1) "lands near the seas" or 2) "islands."
"We cannot see him; it is as if he were sitting in the dark with clouds all around him"

tn.ref: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne
tn.text: The word "throne" is a metonym for the deeds and words of the one who sits on it. The psalmist speaks as if righteousness and justice were physical objects that made the throne secure. AT: "He is righteous and just in everything he does" or "He is able to rule because he rules righteously and justly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "the foundation of his throne"​ refers to how Yahweh rules his kingdom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The psalmist speaks as if fire were a person walking before King Yahweh and telling people that the king was coming. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"burns up his enemies"
"the earth" refers to the people who live on the earth. AT: the people on the earth see and tremble" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"shakes with fear"

tn.ref: The mountains melt like wax before Yahweh
tn.text: "The mountains are unable to stand as Yahweh comes near" or "The mountains crumble in Yahweh's presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

Possible meanings are 1) the psalmist speaks as if the skies are Yahweh's messengers who declare that Yahweh is just. AT: "Everyone can see that God is just, the same way that everyone can see the skies" or 2) the skies refer to the beings that live in the heavens. AT: "All those who live in heaven declare that Yahweh is just" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: All those who worship carved figures will be shamed, those who boast in worthless idols
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "God will shame all those who boast in worthless idols and worship carved figures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Zion heard ... the towns of Judah
tn.text: This refers to the people who live in these lands. AT: "The people of Zion heard ... the people of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The psalmist speaks as if those who were strong enough to rule were the physically higher than others. AT: "rule over all the people who live on" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The psalmist speaks as if those who were strong enough to rule were the physically higher than others. AT: "You are high, far" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"control of the wicked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Light is sown for ... and gladness for
tn.text: These two phrases have similar meanings and are used together for emphasis. AT: "Yahweh sows light for those who do right, and he sows gladness for those with honest hearts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: Light is sown for the righteous
tn.text: The word "sown" is a metaphor for actions with future results. "Light" is a metaphor for good things. AT: "Yahweh plans for good things to happen to the righteous in the future" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The adjective "righteous" can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "righteous people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: and gladness for those with honest hearts
tn.text: "and gladness is sown for those with honest hearts." The word "sown" is a metaphor for actions with future results. AT: "Yahweh plans for people with honest hearts to be happy in the future" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The heart is a synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "honest people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

This verse has a command followed by the reason for the command. If your language requires the reason to precede the command: "Because of what Yahweh has done for you, you righteous people, be glad and give thanks when you remember his holiness."
"Be glad because of what Yahweh has done for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Possible meanings are 1) "when you remember how holy he is" or 2) "to his holy name," a metonym for "to him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
